text:
Currently seems to be impossible to parametrize the uploaded file name in the
HTTP Request sampler.

I'm trying to have the following value in the Filename field of the HTTP Request
sampler:

C:\Test\File${file_number_counter}.xml, where ${file_number_counter} comes from
a Counter pre processor. Of course this assumes that File1.xml, File1000.xml
exist under the specified path. But that is a reasonable assumption.

I found it very important to be able for example to upload a different file for
each user. Otherwise the upload test has a serious limitation. For example, I'm
simulating a situation where 50 users try to upload files to a server
concurrently using HTTP requests. Because of this limitation, each user will
upload the same file which will lead to concurrency errors and even deadlocks on
the specific application I'm testing.

I was debating whether to log this issue as an enhacement or a bug, but I found
it as more of a limitation and a documentation bug since it is unclear where
User Parameters can be utilized.

The only problem I see with fixing this issue is the situation/confusion it will
create for the "Browse..." button next to Filename field. But if you put in the
balance, I find it far more  important to be able to parametrize the uploaded
file name.

I don't have an easy way to test file upload, so I ran a test that showed the
sampler failed to find the generated file name, indicating that the variable had
been recognised. Seems to me that shows variables work OK in the file field.

Perhaps you could add a JavaTest sampler to your test plan to show the value of
the variable? One way to do this is to change the Label to include the variable,
for example:

Label                File=C:\Test\File${file_number_counter}.xml

Note that the error message appeared in the response data pane, and not jmeter.log

This was tested using 2.0.1 and the current 2.0 branch.

I'll attach my test plan.
